trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage AzureML web services using API Management | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage AzureML web services using API Management | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A guide showing how to manage AzureML web services using API Management.
trans-unit.target: A guide showing how to manage AzureML web services using API Management.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage AzureML web services using API Management
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage AzureML web services using API Management

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to quickly get started using API Management to manage your AzureML web services.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to quickly get started using API Management to manage your AzureML web services.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure API Management?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure API Management?

trans-unit.source: Azure API Management is an Azure service that lets you manage your REST API endpoints by defining user access, usage throttling, and dashboard monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Azure API Management is an Azure service that lets you manage your REST API endpoints by defining user access, usage throttling, and dashboard monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/api-management/) for details on Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/api-management/) for details on Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: Click [here](api-management/api-management-get-started.md) for a guide on how to get started with Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Click [here](api-management/api-management-get-started.md) for a guide on how to get started with Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: This other guide, which this guide is based on, covers more topics, including notification configurations, tier pricing, response handling, user authentication, creating products, developer subscriptions, and usage dashboarding.
trans-unit.target: This other guide, which this guide is based on, covers more topics, including notification configurations, tier pricing, response handling, user authentication, creating products, developer subscriptions, and usage dashboarding.

trans-unit.source: What is AzureML?
trans-unit.target: What is AzureML?

trans-unit.source: AzureML is an Azure service for machine learning that enables you to easily build, deploy, and share advanced analytics solutions.
trans-unit.target: AzureML is an Azure service for machine learning that enables you to easily build, deploy, and share advanced analytics solutions.

trans-unit.source: Click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/machine-learning/) for details on AzureML.
trans-unit.target: Click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/machine-learning/) for details on AzureML.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this guide, you need:
trans-unit.target: To complete this guide, you need:

trans-unit.source: An Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have an Azure account, click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) for details on how to create a free trial account.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have an Azure account, click [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) for details on how to create a free trial account.

trans-unit.source: An AzureML account.
trans-unit.target: An AzureML account.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have an AzureML account, click [here](https://studio.azureml.net/) for details on how to create a free trial account.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have an AzureML account, click [here](https://studio.azureml.net/) for details on how to create a free trial account.

trans-unit.source: The workspace, service, and api_key for an AzureML experiment deployed as a web service.
trans-unit.target: The workspace, service, and api_key for an AzureML experiment deployed as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Click [here](machine-learning/machine-learning-create-experiment.md) for details on how to create an AzureML experiment.
trans-unit.target: Click [here](machine-learning/machine-learning-create-experiment.md) for details on how to create an AzureML experiment.

trans-unit.source: Click [here](machine-learning/machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md) for details on how to deploy an AzureML experiment as a web service.
trans-unit.target: Click [here](machine-learning/machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md) for details on how to deploy an AzureML experiment as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, Appendix A has instructions for how to create and test a simple AzureML experiment and deploy it as a web service.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, Appendix A has instructions for how to create and test a simple AzureML experiment and deploy it as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Create an API Management instance
trans-unit.target: Create an API Management instance

trans-unit.source: Below are the steps for using API Management to manage your AzureML web service.
trans-unit.target: Below are the steps for using API Management to manage your AzureML web service.

trans-unit.source: First create a service instance.
trans-unit.target: First create a service instance.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the [Classic Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/) and click **New** > **App Services** > **API Management** > **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the [Classic Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/) and click **New** > **App Services** > **API Management** > **Create**.

trans-unit.source: ![create-instance](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/create-instance.png)
trans-unit.target: ![create-instance](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/create-instance.png)

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique **URL**.

trans-unit.source: This guide uses **demoazureml** – you will need to choose something different.
trans-unit.target: This guide uses **demoazureml** – you will need to choose something different.

trans-unit.source: Choose the desired **Subscription** and **Region** for your service instance.
trans-unit.target: Choose the desired **Subscription** and **Region** for your service instance.

trans-unit.source: After making your selections, click the next button.
trans-unit.target: After making your selections, click the next button.

trans-unit.source: ![create-service-1](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/create-service-1.png)
trans-unit.target: ![create-service-1](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/create-service-1.png)

trans-unit.source: Specify a value for the **Organization Name**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a value for the **Organization Name**.

trans-unit.source: This guide uses **demoazureml** – you will need to choose something different.
trans-unit.target: This guide uses **demoazureml** – you will need to choose something different.

trans-unit.source: Enter your email address in the **administrator e-mail** field.
trans-unit.target: Enter your email address in the **administrator e-mail** field.

trans-unit.source: This email address is used for notifications from the API Management system.
trans-unit.target: This email address is used for notifications from the API Management system.

trans-unit.source: ![create-service-2](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/create-service-2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![create-service-2](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/create-service-2.png)

trans-unit.source: Click the check box to create your service instance.
trans-unit.target: Click the check box to create your service instance.

trans-unit.source: *It takes up to thirty minutes for a new service to be created*.
trans-unit.target: *It takes up to thirty minutes for a new service to be created*.

trans-unit.source: Create the API
trans-unit.target: Create the API

trans-unit.source: Once the service instance is created, the next step is to create the API.
trans-unit.target: Once the service instance is created, the next step is to create the API.

trans-unit.source: An API consists of a set of operations that can be invoked from a client application.
trans-unit.target: An API consists of a set of operations that can be invoked from a client application.

trans-unit.source: API operations are proxied to existing web services.
trans-unit.target: API operations are proxied to existing web services.

trans-unit.source: This guide creates APIs that proxy to the existing AzureML RRS and BES web services.
trans-unit.target: This guide creates APIs that proxy to the existing AzureML RRS and BES web services.

trans-unit.source: APIs are created and configured from the API publisher portal, which is accessed through the Azure Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: APIs are created and configured from the API publisher portal, which is accessed through the Azure Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: To reach the publisher portal, select your service instance.
trans-unit.target: To reach the publisher portal, select your service instance.

trans-unit.source: ![select-service-instance](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/select-service-instance.png)
trans-unit.target: ![select-service-instance](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/select-service-instance.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: ![manage-service](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/manage-service.png)
trans-unit.target: ![manage-service](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/manage-service.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **Add API**.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **Add API**.

trans-unit.source: ![api-management-menu](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/api-management-menu.png)
trans-unit.target: ![api-management-menu](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/api-management-menu.png)

trans-unit.source: Type **AzureML Demo API** as the **Web API name**.
trans-unit.target: Type **AzureML Demo API** as the **Web API name**.

trans-unit.source: Type **https://ussouthcentral.services.azureml.net** as the **Web service URL**.
trans-unit.target: Type **https://ussouthcentral.services.azureml.net** as the **Web service URL**.

trans-unit.source: Type **azureml-demo** as the **Web API URL suffix**.
trans-unit.target: Type **azureml-demo** as the **Web API URL suffix**.

trans-unit.source: Check **HTTPS** as the **Web API URL** scheme.
trans-unit.target: Check **HTTPS** as the **Web API URL** scheme.

trans-unit.source: Select **Starter** as **Products**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Starter** as **Products**.

trans-unit.source: When finished, click **Save** to create the API.
trans-unit.target: When finished, click **Save** to create the API.

trans-unit.source: ![add-new-api](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-new-api.png)
trans-unit.target: ![add-new-api](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-new-api.png)

trans-unit.source: Add the operations
trans-unit.target: Add the operations

trans-unit.source: Click **Add operation** to add operations to this API.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add operation** to add operations to this API.

trans-unit.source: ![add-operation](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-operation.png)
trans-unit.target: ![add-operation](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-operation.png)

trans-unit.source: The **New operation** window will be displayed and the **Signature** tab will be selected by default.
trans-unit.target: The **New operation** window will be displayed and the **Signature** tab will be selected by default.

trans-unit.source: Add RRS Operation
trans-unit.target: Add RRS Operation

trans-unit.source: First create an operation for the AzureML RRS service.
trans-unit.target: First create an operation for the AzureML RRS service.

trans-unit.source: Select **POST** as the **HTTP verb**.
trans-unit.target: Select **POST** as the **HTTP verb**.

trans-unit.source: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/execute?api-version={apiversion}&details={details}** as the **URL template**.
trans-unit.target: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/execute?api-version={apiversion}&details={details}** as the **URL template**.

trans-unit.source: Type **RRS Execute** as the **Display name**.
trans-unit.target: Type **RRS Execute** as the **Display name**.

trans-unit.source: ![add-rrs-operation-signature](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-rrs-operation-signature.png)
trans-unit.target: ![add-rrs-operation-signature](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-rrs-operation-signature.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save this operation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save this operation.

trans-unit.source: ![add-rrs-operation-response](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-rrs-operation-response.png)
trans-unit.target: ![add-rrs-operation-response](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/add-rrs-operation-response.png)

trans-unit.source: Add BES Operations
trans-unit.target: Add BES Operations

trans-unit.source: Screenshots are not included for the BES operations as they are very similar to those for adding the RRS operation.
trans-unit.target: Screenshots are not included for the BES operations as they are very similar to those for adding the RRS operation.

trans-unit.source: Submit (but not start) a Batch Execution job
trans-unit.target: Submit (but not start) a Batch Execution job

trans-unit.source: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.
trans-unit.target: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.

trans-unit.source: Select **POST** for the **HTTP verb**.
trans-unit.target: Select **POST** for the **HTTP verb**.

trans-unit.source: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.
trans-unit.target: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.

trans-unit.source: Type **BES Submit** for the **Display name**.
trans-unit.target: Type **BES Submit** for the **Display name**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save this operation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save this operation.

trans-unit.source: Start a Batch Execution job
trans-unit.target: Start a Batch Execution job

trans-unit.source: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.
trans-unit.target: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.

trans-unit.source: Select **POST** for the **HTTP verb**.
trans-unit.target: Select **POST** for the **HTTP verb**.

trans-unit.source: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs/{jobid}/start?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.
trans-unit.target: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs/{jobid}/start?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.

trans-unit.source: Type **BES Start** for the **Display name**.
trans-unit.target: Type **BES Start** for the **Display name**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save this operation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save this operation.

trans-unit.source: Get the status or result of a Batch Execution job
trans-unit.target: Get the status or result of a Batch Execution job

trans-unit.source: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.
trans-unit.target: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.

trans-unit.source: Select **GET** for the **HTTP verb**.
trans-unit.target: Select **GET** for the **HTTP verb**.

trans-unit.source: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs/{jobid}?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.
trans-unit.target: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs/{jobid}?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.

trans-unit.source: Type **BES Status** for the **Display name**.
trans-unit.target: Type **BES Status** for the **Display name**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save this operation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save this operation.

trans-unit.source: Delete a Batch Execution job
trans-unit.target: Delete a Batch Execution job

trans-unit.source: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.
trans-unit.target: Click **add operation** to add the AzureML BES operation to the API.

trans-unit.source: Select **DELETE** for the **HTTP verb**.
trans-unit.target: Select **DELETE** for the **HTTP verb**.

trans-unit.source: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs/{jobid}?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.
trans-unit.target: Type **/workspaces/{workspace}/services/{service}/jobs/{jobid}?api-version={apiversion}** for the **URL template**.

trans-unit.source: Type **BES Delete** for the **Display name**.
trans-unit.target: Type **BES Delete** for the **Display name**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Responses** > **ADD** on the left and select **200 OK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save this operation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save this operation.

trans-unit.source: Call an operation from the Developer Portal
trans-unit.target: Call an operation from the Developer Portal

trans-unit.source: Operations can be called directly from the Developer portal, which provides a convenient way to view and test the operations of an API.
trans-unit.target: Operations can be called directly from the Developer portal, which provides a convenient way to view and test the operations of an API.

trans-unit.source: In this guide step you will call the **RRS Execute** method that was added to the **AzureML Demo API**.
trans-unit.target: In this guide step you will call the **RRS Execute** method that was added to the **AzureML Demo API**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Developer portal** from the menu at the top right of the Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: Click **Developer portal** from the menu at the top right of the Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: ![developer-portal](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/developer-portal.png)
trans-unit.target: ![developer-portal](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/developer-portal.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the top menu, and then click **AzureML Demo API** to see the operations available.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the top menu, and then click **AzureML Demo API** to see the operations available.

trans-unit.source: ![demoazureml-api](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/demoazureml-api.png)
trans-unit.target: ![demoazureml-api](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/demoazureml-api.png)

trans-unit.source: Select **RRS Execute** for the operation.
trans-unit.target: Select **RRS Execute** for the operation.

trans-unit.source: Click **Try It**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Try It**.

trans-unit.source: ![try-it](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/try-it.png)
trans-unit.target: ![try-it](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/try-it.png)

trans-unit.source: For Request parameters, type your **workspace**, **service**, **2.0** for the **apiversion**, and **true** for the **details**.
trans-unit.target: For Request parameters, type your **workspace**, **service**, **2.0** for the **apiversion**, and **true** for the **details**.

trans-unit.source: You can find your **workspace** and **service** in the AzureML web service dashboard (see **Test the web service** in Appendix A).
trans-unit.target: You can find your **workspace** and **service** in the AzureML web service dashboard (see **Test the web service** in Appendix A).

trans-unit.source: For Request headers, click **Add header** and type **Content-Type** and **application/json**, then click **Add header** and type **Authorization** and **Bearer <YOUR AZUREML SERVICE API-KEY>**.
trans-unit.target: For Request headers, click **Add header** and type **Content-Type** and **application/json**, then click **Add header** and type **Authorization** and **Bearer <YOUR AZUREML SERVICE API-KEY>**.

trans-unit.source: You can find your **api key** in the AzureML web service dashboard (see **Test the web service** in Appendix A).
trans-unit.target: You can find your **api key** in the AzureML web service dashboard (see **Test the web service** in Appendix A).

trans-unit.source: Type **{"Inputs": {"input1": {"ColumnNames": ["Col2"], "Values": [["This is a good day"]]}}, "GlobalParameters": {}}** for the request body.
trans-unit.target: Type **{"Inputs": {"input1": {"ColumnNames": ["Col2"], "Values": [["This is a good day"]]}}, "GlobalParameters": {}}** for the request body.

trans-unit.source: ![azureml-demo-api](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/azureml-demo-api.png)
trans-unit.target: ![azureml-demo-api](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/azureml-demo-api.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Send**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Send**.

trans-unit.source: ![send](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/send.png)
trans-unit.target: ![send](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/send.png)

trans-unit.source: After an operation is invoked, the developer portal displays the **Requested URL** from the back-end service, the **Response status**, the **Response headers**, and any **Response content**.
trans-unit.target: After an operation is invoked, the developer portal displays the **Requested URL** from the back-end service, the **Response status**, the **Response headers**, and any **Response content**.

trans-unit.source: ![response-status](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/response-status.png)
trans-unit.target: ![response-status](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/response-status.png)

trans-unit.source: Appendix A - Creating and testing a simple AzureML web service
trans-unit.target: Appendix A - Creating and testing a simple AzureML web service

trans-unit.source: Creating the experiment
trans-unit.target: Creating the experiment

trans-unit.source: Below are the steps for creating a simple AzureML experiment and deploying it as a web service.
trans-unit.target: Below are the steps for creating a simple AzureML experiment and deploying it as a web service.

trans-unit.source: The web service takes as input a column of arbitrary text and returns a set of features represented as integers.
trans-unit.target: The web service takes as input a column of arbitrary text and returns a set of features represented as integers.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Text
trans-unit.target: Text

trans-unit.source: Hashed Text
trans-unit.target: Hashed Text

trans-unit.source: This is a good day
trans-unit.target: This is a good day

trans-unit.source: First, using a browser of your choice, navigate to: [https://studio.azureml.net/](https://studio.azureml.net/) and enter your credentials to log in.
trans-unit.target: First, using a browser of your choice, navigate to: [https://studio.azureml.net/](https://studio.azureml.net/) and enter your credentials to log in.

trans-unit.source: Next, create a new blank experiment.
trans-unit.target: Next, create a new blank experiment.

trans-unit.source: ![search-experiment-templates](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/search-experiment-templates.png)
trans-unit.target: ![search-experiment-templates](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/search-experiment-templates.png)

trans-unit.source: Rename it to **SimpleFeatureHashingExperiment**.
trans-unit.target: Rename it to **SimpleFeatureHashingExperiment**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Saved Datasets** and drag **Book Reviews from Amazon** onto your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Saved Datasets** and drag **Book Reviews from Amazon** onto your experiment.

trans-unit.source: ![simple-feature-hashing-experiment](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/simple-feature-hashing-experiment.png)
trans-unit.target: ![simple-feature-hashing-experiment](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/simple-feature-hashing-experiment.png)

trans-unit.source: Expand **Data Transformation** and **Manipulation** and drag **Project Columns** onto your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Data Transformation** and **Manipulation** and drag **Project Columns** onto your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect **Book Reviews from Amazon** to **Project Columns**.
trans-unit.target: Connect **Book Reviews from Amazon** to **Project Columns**.

trans-unit.source: ![project-columns](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/project-columns.png)
trans-unit.target: ![project-columns](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/project-columns.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Project Columns** and then click **Launch column selector** and select **Col2**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Project Columns** and then click **Launch column selector** and select **Col2**.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark to apply these changes.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark to apply these changes.

trans-unit.source: ![select-columns](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/select-columns.png)
trans-unit.target: ![select-columns](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/select-columns.png)

trans-unit.source: Expand **Text Analytics** and drag **Feature Hashing** onto the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Text Analytics** and drag **Feature Hashing** onto the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect **Project Columns** to **Feature Hashing**.
trans-unit.target: Connect **Project Columns** to **Feature Hashing**.

trans-unit.source: ![connect-project-columns](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/connect-project-columns.png)
trans-unit.target: ![connect-project-columns](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/connect-project-columns.png)

trans-unit.source: Type **3** for the **Hashing bitsize**.
trans-unit.target: Type **3** for the **Hashing bitsize**.

trans-unit.source: This will create 8 (23) columns.
trans-unit.target: This will create 8 (23) columns.

trans-unit.source: ![hashing-bitsize](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/hashing-bitsize.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hashing-bitsize](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/hashing-bitsize.png)

trans-unit.source: At this point, you may want to click **Run** to test the experiment.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you may want to click **Run** to test the experiment.

trans-unit.source: ![run](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/run.png)
trans-unit.target: ![run](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/run.png)

trans-unit.source: Create a web service
trans-unit.target: Create a web service

trans-unit.source: Now create a web service.
trans-unit.target: Now create a web service.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Web Service** and drag **Input** onto your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Web Service** and drag **Input** onto your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect **Input** to **Feature Hashing**.
trans-unit.target: Connect **Input** to **Feature Hashing**.

trans-unit.source: Also drag **output** onto your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Also drag **output** onto your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect **Output** to **Feature Hashing**.
trans-unit.target: Connect **Output** to **Feature Hashing**.

trans-unit.source: ![output-to-feature-hashing](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/output-to-feature-hashing.png)
trans-unit.target: ![output-to-feature-hashing](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/output-to-feature-hashing.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish web service**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish web service**.

trans-unit.source: ![publish-web-service](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/publish-web-service.png)
trans-unit.target: ![publish-web-service](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/publish-web-service.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes** to publish the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes** to publish the experiment.

trans-unit.source: ![yes-to-publish](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/yes-to-publish.png)
trans-unit.target: ![yes-to-publish](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/yes-to-publish.png)

trans-unit.source: Test the web service
trans-unit.target: Test the web service

trans-unit.source: An AzureML web service consists of RSS (request/response service) and BES (batch execution service) endpoints.
trans-unit.target: An AzureML web service consists of RSS (request/response service) and BES (batch execution service) endpoints.

trans-unit.source: RSS is for synchronous execution.
trans-unit.target: RSS is for synchronous execution.

trans-unit.source: BES is for asynchronous job execution.
trans-unit.target: BES is for asynchronous job execution.

trans-unit.source: To test your web service with the sample Python source below, you may need to download and install the Azure SDK for Python (see: [How to install Python](python-how-to-install.md)).
trans-unit.target: To test your web service with the sample Python source below, you may need to download and install the Azure SDK for Python (see: [How to install Python](python-how-to-install.md)).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the **workspace**, **service**, and **api_key** of your experiment for the sample source below.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the **workspace**, **service**, and **api_key** of your experiment for the sample source below.

trans-unit.source: You can find the workspace and service by clicking either **Request/Response** or **Batch Execution** for your experiment in the web service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can find the workspace and service by clicking either **Request/Response** or **Batch Execution** for your experiment in the web service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: ![find-workspace-and-service](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/find-workspace-and-service.png)
trans-unit.target: ![find-workspace-and-service](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/find-workspace-and-service.png)

trans-unit.source: You can find the **api_key** by clicking your experiment in the web service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can find the **api_key** by clicking your experiment in the web service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: ![find-api-key](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/find-api-key.png)
trans-unit.target: ![find-api-key](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/find-api-key.png)

trans-unit.source: Test RRS endpoint
trans-unit.target: Test RRS endpoint

trans-unit.source: Test button
trans-unit.target: Test button

trans-unit.source: An easy way to test the RRS endpoint is to click **Test** on the web service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: An easy way to test the RRS endpoint is to click **Test** on the web service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: ![test](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/test.png)
trans-unit.target: ![test](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/test.png)

trans-unit.source: Type **This is a good day** for **col2**.
trans-unit.target: Type **This is a good day** for **col2**.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark.

trans-unit.source: ![enter-data](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/enter-data.png)
trans-unit.target: ![enter-data](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/enter-data.png)

trans-unit.source: You will see something like
trans-unit.target: You will see something like

trans-unit.source: ![sample-output](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/sample-output.png)
trans-unit.target: ![sample-output](./media/machine-learning-manage-web-service-endpoints-using-api-management/sample-output.png)

trans-unit.source: Sample Code
trans-unit.target: Sample Code

trans-unit.source: Another way to test your RRS is from your client code.
trans-unit.target: Another way to test your RRS is from your client code.

trans-unit.source: If you click **Request/response** on the dashboard and scroll to the bottom, you will see sample code for C#, Python, and R. You will also see the syntax of the RRS request, including the request URI, headers, and body.
trans-unit.target: If you click **Request/response** on the dashboard and scroll to the bottom, you will see sample code for C#, Python, and R. You will also see the syntax of the RRS request, including the request URI, headers, and body.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows a working Python example.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows a working Python example.

trans-unit.source: You will need to modify it with the **workspace**, **service**, and **api_key** of your experiment.
trans-unit.target: You will need to modify it with the **workspace**, **service**, and **api_key** of your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Test BES endpoint Click **Batch execution** on the dashboard and scroll to the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Test BES endpoint Click **Batch execution** on the dashboard and scroll to the bottom.

trans-unit.source: You will see sample code for C#, Python, and R. You will also see the syntax of the BES requests to submit a job, start a job, get the status or results of a job, and delete a job.
trans-unit.target: You will see sample code for C#, Python, and R. You will also see the syntax of the BES requests to submit a job, start a job, get the status or results of a job, and delete a job.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows a working Python example.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows a working Python example.

trans-unit.source: You need to modify it with the **workspace**, **service**, and **api_key** of your experiment.
trans-unit.target: You need to modify it with the **workspace**, **service**, and **api_key** of your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you need to modify the **storage account name**, **storage account key**, and **storage container name**.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you need to modify the **storage account name**, **storage account key**, and **storage container name**.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, you will need to modify the location of the **input file** and the location of the **output file**.
trans-unit.target: Lastly, you will need to modify the location of the **input file** and the location of the **output file**.
